alert.note: Alert for LaMoure (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 11:05AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the James River at Lamoure affecting LaMoure County in North Dakota... .Recent rainfall is working its way down the James River, and may cause minor flooding in the Lamoure area. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Lamoure. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.7 feet, Rising water begins to affect the city of LaMoure`s sewer system. Water restrictions have been used in the past to counteract these effects. At 14.0 feet, Urban flood stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to around flood stage on Wednesday, and then will begin slowly falling. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 03/24/1994. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
